channel.title: Global keybinder on Linux / nightly builds fix
channel.description:
Hey Mopar, you'll probably need to add / get the libkeybinder library for the Simba Linux nightly builds. I'm currently using it in the Linux version to provide the required global key binding. I'll look into making it optional later. Actually, I'm not entirely sure whether to ship it with Simba if I make it optional. People can also install it with their package manager...
See this commit (https://github.com/MerlijnWajer/Simba/commit/ac0f977cc833155e1d81ad892a8c83721923c67a) for a link to the keybinder webpage. I'm pretty sure it is in the debian/ubuntu package manager. (IIRC you used one of those)

item.title: Global keybinder on Linux / nightly builds fix
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Hey Mopar, you’ll probably need to add / get the libkeybinder library for the Simba Linux nightly builds. I’m currently using it in the Linux version to provide the required global key binding. I’ll look into making it optional later. Actually, I’m not entirely sure whether to ship it with Simba if I make it optional. People can also install it with their package manager…

See this commit (https://github.com/MerlijnWajer/Simba/commit/ac0f977cc833155e1d81ad892a8c83721923c67a) for a link to the keybinder webpage. I’m pretty sure it is in the debian/ubuntu package manager. (IIRC you used one of those)
